result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Edward P Greene Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Department. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 4 Months are Straight Time. Balance in Non-working hours, with release for Standard Condtions. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 83 days were granted. 
May transfer to Milwaukee County but NO Electronic Monitoring Allowed.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Edward P Greene in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  Counts #2-4 are dismissed and read-in.  Count #5 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

42 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  24 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS;  **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Attend Victim Impact Panel 
*Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department);

FINE:   $3,039.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  12 MONTHS- 1ST 4 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME (83 days credit) - remainder non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody)  - Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County but NO electronic monitoring allowed.   

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Motion hearing on July 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
(Orig.) ... to file an amended information. Filed by the State.
Witness list attached. Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Including Stip and Order for return of Exhibits.
for return/destruction of exhibits

Defendant Edward P Greene in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.   Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received.  City of Brookfield police officer Andrew Wichlacz sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Hirt.   Cross examination by Attorney Bricco.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense objects.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Bricco requests a speedy trial.  Attorney Bricco to obtain a court date from the Clerk of Courts office.   Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program. Defendant to only be released to SCRAM. If defendant does operate a vehicle he must have the Ignition Interlock installed.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
